meaningMnemonic: This is kind of a "set phrase" in Japanese, though we're going to treat it like a vocab word here (because it's so common and useful!). You know that <kanji>久</kanji> means "long time" - so now let's pay attention to the kana: しぶり. Just imagine that <reading>she buri</reading>ed you alive, then a few days later came back to dig you up. The first thing she says is "<vocabulary>LONG TIME NO SEE!</vocabulary>"
readingMnemonic: You learned this reading when you learned 久しい. It's the same one!
